page.title: 08Housing
page.content: It is the concentration of 'miners rows' which give the villagesof East Wemyss and Coaltown of Wemyss their character. Some of the houses are privately owned, others are council houses and there are also a number which are owned by the Wemyss estate. Unfortunately there are a number of vacated and boarded up houses awaiting rehabilitation and other poorly maintained properties which give a general impression of decay and neglect. However other parts are attractive and well kept. In Buckhaven the original town centre has fallen into decay however, steps are now being taken to make improvements to the physical structure in this area rather than build houses on the outskirts of the town where the majority of the grond is high quality agricultural land.
